llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Based on the information provided in the query, I have constructed a 3-day journey itinerary for two people from Chicago to Albany that takes place from March 22nd to March 24th, 2022. The budget for this trip is $2,300, and we will be staying in entire rooms that allow smoking.

Day 1 (March 22nd):

* Depart Chicago at 7:00 AM on flight F3605761, arriving in Albany at 10:04 AM.
* Check-in to the Sunny, 1 Bedroom in Bedstuy, Brooklyn (entire home/apt, smoking allowed, $200 per night).
* Spend the rest of the day exploring the neighborhood and enjoying local cuisine.

Day 2 (March 23rd):

* Check-out from the Sunny, 1 Bedroom in Bedstuy, Brooklyn and depart Albany at 10:58 AM on flight F3732604, arriving in Chicago at 12:18 PM.
* Stay overnight at the Private Room in Union Square (entire room, smoking allowed, $150 per night).
* Explore the city and enjoy local cuisine.

Day 3 (March 24th):

* Check-out from the Private Room in Union Square and depart Chicago at 10:58 AM on flight F3854585, arriving in Albany at 12:18 PM.
* Stay overnight at the 2Br~Union square~Newly furnished (entire home/apt, smoking allowed, $180 per night).
* Spend the rest of the day exploring the city and enjoying local cuisine.

Total cost for this itinerary: $910 ($200 per night x 3 nights in Brooklyn + $150 per night x 1 night in Chicago + $180 per night x 1 night in Albany)

I hope this itinerary meets your requirements and provides a enjoyable trip for you! Let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance.
